author: _prefontaine
content: In a sharded chain, validators commit transactions to specific shards. Are validators forever assigned to one shard, or do they ever get reassigned? For example, what happens if a validator is online, goes offline for a while (1 year let's say), then comes back online. Does it still commit transactions to the same shard as before?

author: pietjepuk
content:
What article/post are you basing your questions on? My understanding of how shard might work in Ethereum is that _users_ choose what shard to publish transactions to. Validators are assigned to random committees, and the shard that a validator has to attest to changes over time. That "shuffling/randomizing over time" part is implied by a statements like _"They may get lucky once in a while by random chance, but only if they control a very large fraction (> 1/3) of all validators."_ , so not entirely sure about that.

Check out https://github.com/tvanepps/EthereumDiscordGuidebook/blob/main/README.md#sharded-data for an overview of sharding docs if you haven't yet
